column1: Ioreth was a woman of Gondor during the War of the Ring.
Ioreth was originally from Imloth Melui in Lossarnach
column2: but moved to Minas Tirith and worked in the Houses of Healing. By  she was the oldest woman working there and was well versed in old lore
column3: which helped restore the health of Faramir.  She was very talkative

column1: Ioreth means "old woman" in Sindarin; iaur "old" plus feminine ending -eth. In draft
column2: Tolkien had spelt her name Yoreth.J.R.R. Tolkien
column4: published in Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull
column5: The Lord of the Rings: A Readers Companion

column2: it was specifically chosen to suit the character of the old nurse.

column1: 1956: The Lord of the Rings (1956 radio series):
:Prunella Scales is credited as Ioreth in the fifth episode of the second run
column6: 1956 As Scales was in her twenties at the time
column7: it is unknown to what extent the "old lady" aspect was used.

column1: 1979: The Lord of the Rings (1979 radio series):
:Pat Franklyn is credited as "The Old Woman". She is not referred to as Ioreth at any time
column2: but her lines are lifted from Ioreths.The Lord of the Rings (1979 radio series)
column3: "The Sword That Was Broken... New Forged"

column1: 1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Pauline Letts plays Ioreth.The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)
